content: If you have found a bug, please submit it via <1>forum</1> or contact us at <3>{{supportEmail}}</3>.

comment.text: This translation key provides a message for displaying when a user finds a bug. It informs users to submit their findings via the forum or contact support at a specified email address. This text appears in the UI as part of the beta badge component.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets <1> and <3> are preserved in the Arabic translation, mirroring the English content's formatting. This is technically correct, but might not be the standard Arabic formatting for hyperlinks or email addresses.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider replacing <1> with a more standard Arabic hyperlink formatting, if applicable. Similarly, assess if <3> is the preferred way to denote an email address in Arabic. For example, use 'عبر البريد الإلكتروني' (via email) instead of <3>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` and `<3>` tags are not translated. They should ideally be handled consistently with the English version if they represent specific UI elements or formatting instructions. However, without knowing their intended purpose, I can only note this.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Determine the purpose of the `<1>` and `<3>` tags and apply the appropriate handling in the Azerbaijani translation. If they represent UI elements, ensure they are localized or rendered correctly.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'forum' has been directly translated to 'φόρουμ'. While understandable, a more natural Greek phrasing would be 'φόρουμ συζητήσεων' or simply 'φόρουμ'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Εάν έχετε βρει κάποιο σφάλμα, υποβάλετέ το μέσω <1>φόρουμ συζητήσεων</1> ή επικοινωνήστε μαζί μας στο <3>{{supportEmail}}</3>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Armenian versions. While not inherently incorrect, it's important to verify that these tags are intended and render correctly in the target platform. Consider removing them if they are not functional.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the intended functionality of the <1> and </1> tags. Remove them if they're not necessary.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "If you have found a bug" is translated as "バグを発見された場合は". While technically correct, a more natural and polite phrasing would be "バグを見つけられた場合は" or "バグを発見した場合は". The current translation sounds slightly stiff.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: バグを見つけられた場合は

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "submit it via" is translated to "報告いただくか". While understandable, it's a slightly verbose way to say it. A more direct translation would be "報告してください" or "ご報告ください".
'forum' was translated as 'සංසදය'. 'සංසදය' means 'parliament' or 'debate', not a forum. A more appropriate translation would be something like 'මණިපදය' (manipadaya) or 'Discussion මණ්ඩලය'.

The angle brackets (<1> and <3>) are preserved in the Slovenian translation, mirroring the English. While not technically incorrect, it's unusual for Slovenian text to use such formatting. It's recommended to remove them.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the angle brackets around 'foruma' and '{{supportEmail}}'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "forum" is transliterated but not translated. The correct translation of "forum" in this context would be "форум". While technically correct, it's preferable to use the more common Serbian word, 'diskusioni forum' or similar.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'форум' or 'дискусион форум' for a more natural-sounding translation.
